Protests.title: Hands Off Rafah - Ceasefire Now
Protests.description: Seattle is home to major corporations, universities, politicians, and media that are supporting Israel's genocidal occupation. But Seattle is also home to hundreds of thousands of people who firmly stand with Palestine and their struggle for liberation! As Israel and the US threaten Rafah with invasion, the time is now to mobilize! No amount of repression and intimidation will stop us. Join us and continue to shut it down for Palestine! #shutitdown4palestine
Protests.img_alt_text: Poster for Hands off Rafah Protest in Seattle

Protests.title: End the Vegan Milk Surcharge, Starbucks!
Protests.description: Starbucks is contributing over 16 million tons of carbon into our atmosphere every year. Over 1/5, or 3.52 million, comes from dairy milk alone. That's twice as much as their coffee and four times as much as their packaging! They continue to present themselves as a forward conscious company, committing to sustainability goals. We need to show them we see through their green-washing manipulation tactics and won't allow baby cows to be murdered for lattes and frappuccinos. We need accessibility to veganism for everyone in order to prevent unnecessary cruelty to animals and destruction to our planet. Starbucks already offers non-dairy milk for the same cost as cow's milk in the UK, France and Germany. When much smaller chains like Stumptown Coffee can offer oat milk as their default milk, massive Starbucks can afford to do what's right for the environment, animals and Americans.
Protests.img_alt_text: Protestors with signs on vegan milk surcharge outside of Suzzallo Library

Protests.title: Protest Jimmy John's and Inspire Brands
Protests.description: Inspire has a bunch of big names under their management, including Arby's, Baskin Robbins, Buffalo Wild Wings, Dunkin'' Donuts, Jimmy John's and Sonic. Inspire committed to source 100% cage-free eggs globally by 2025, but have not been reporting on their progress. We're asking them to resume reporting on their progress towards cage free. Getting them to report would be a big win: they have over 31,700 restaurants worldwide. We're targeting Jimmy John's as part of a national pressure campaign. Come join us as we hold signs and talk to patron and employees about why its important that Jimmy John's (and Inspire Brands generally) report progress against their promise to phase out cruel cages for hens.
Protests.img_alt_text: Logo for The Humane League, showing three individuals as protestors

Protests.title: Protest Boeing's War Profiteer Extravaganza (A&DSS)
Protests.description: Boeing makes the majority of its $60+ billion in annual revenues from defense contracts, including one for 1,800 missile targeting kits Israel uses to bomb Gaza. The war has killed or wounded over a hundred thousand Gazans (over five percent of Gaza‚Äôs total population) and left the majority of the surviving population at immediate risk of starvation unless a ceasefire is implemented. As Washingtonians, our federal, state, and even local taxes subsidize Boeing‚Äôs support for Israel‚Äôs genocidal campaign in Gaza. Make your voice heard and stand with the people of Gaza by demanding an immediate and permanent ceasefire, an end to US military aid to Israel, and an end to the US war on Yemen.
Protests.location_name: Seattle Convention Center Jim Ellis Plaza
Protests.img_alt_text: Poster for No To Boeing Protest in Seattle

Protests.title: The Official San Diego Animal Rights March 2024
Protests.description: ü•ÅThe Official San Diego Animal Rights March is back!ü•Å And the animals need YOU!!! Together we stand up, speak out and demand NO MORE OPPRESSION, ANIMAL LIBERATION for ALL EARTHLINGS. Right here in San Diego and across the globe we unite for our animal friends! In order to make this march successful, we need your support. Please invite your friends and tell every vegan you meet that this is the day where we unite, where we stand up, rise up and say no more animal abuse!
Protests.img_alt_text: Protestors hold signs for the rights of pigs, cows, and chickens in San Diego

Protests.title: Take Back the Night
Protests.description: TBTN is a yearly international protest founded in 1976 which seeks to raise awareness about the realities of sexual and domestic violence on campus and in the community, both for survivors of sexual and domestic violence and those who want to support and bear witness in solidarity. TBTN is a survivor-centered event that begins with a Rally in the EMU Amphitheater at 6pm, continues at 7pm as a  March through the streets of Eugene to symbolize reclaiming people‚Äôs safety on public streets at night ‚Äì and ends back on campus for a Speak Out in the EMU.
Protests.img_alt_text: Sign for Feminist Hive, showing a fist within a beehive

Protests.title: Rapid Fire Action Half Hour (Virtual)
Protests.description: Digital actions are one of the easiest and effective forms of activism to improve the lives of animals in the food system. We understand that in our busy lives we might forget to keep up with the actions, and assume we're 'just one person.' But only as a collective do we have the power to end corporate greed. So, we would like to create a space where we all dedicate 20-30 minutes a week taking these essential actions, calling out companies for their lack of transparency and basic animal welfare.
Protests.img_alt_text: Four individuals signing a paper, urging protestors to join

Protests.title: Dump the Vegan Milk Surcharge Already!!!!!
Protests.description: This will be a peaceful indoor protest at a Starbucks location to send our message that we want this multi-billion dollar corporation to simply charge parity between non-dairy and dairy milks. Starbucks is contributing over 16 million tons of carbon into our atmosphere every year. Over 1/5, or 3.52 million, comes from dairy milk alone. That's twice as much as their coffee and four times as much as their packaging! They continue to present themselves as a forward conscious company, committing to sustainability goals. We need to show them we see through their green-washing manipulation tactics and won't allow baby cows to be murdered for lattes and frappuccinos. We need accessibility to veganism for everyone in order to prevent unnecessary cruelty to animals and destruction to our planet. Starbucks already offers non-dairy milk for the same cost as cow's milk in the UK, France and Germany. When much smaller chains like Stumptown Coffee can offer oat milk as their default milk, massive Starbucks can afford to do what's right for the environment, animals and Americans.
Protests.location_name: Seattle Center Armory Food & Event Hall Starbucks
Protests.img_alt_text: Starbucks cup with demands to stop charging extra for vegan milk, with protestors in the background

Protests.title: Rally at Kamlager-Dove's Office
Protests.description: Tell Rep. Kamlager-Dove: no arms to Israel! Fund UNRWA! Permanent Ceasefire Now!
Protests.img_alt_text: Event poster with details and Rep. Kamlager-Dove on the right

Protests.title: ‚ÄúWhat Would Esther Do‚Äù: Purim for Liberation and Peace
Protests.description: Join us for a rally that fulfills some of the mitzvot of Purim while calling for a lasting ceasefire. There will be solidarity, hamantaschen, groggers, calls for justice, songs, fundraising for humanitarian aid to Gaza, alternate imaginings of how the Purim story could end, and more!
Protests.location_name: Cal Anderson Park, North of Fountain
